intro: Baccaurea harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand’s baccaurea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically covered in a fleshy, hairy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
